page.title: 19HOLROYD MILL
page.content: HOLROYD MILL is on the border of Micklethwaite and Morton.It was built in the year 1812 AD.It is made of Yorkshire stone.when it was built it was used as a textile mill making wool and cloth .It closed down in 1926 and was left to fall down.But it was reopened in 1978 and it is now used as a craft mill.The nine people that work in the mill make,furniture,clocks, paper,irish bag pipes,jewerlly.They also do silver smithing,weaving,and they bind and restore old books.Down by the pond mill there two cottages.In one of these two people live perminently.in the others people come for a week or more.They choose a certain craft to learn and the workers teach them how to e.g.make bag pipes. Holroyd mill is surrouned by fields, and farms.There is also a large pond down by the mill where they keep ducks
